definition: to hit a pressure point (martial arts)/dim mak/see also 點脈|点脉[dian3 mai4]

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Methods: 11 male tennis players were randomly sampled into a control group and an experimental group.
sentences.chinese: 對11名男子網球運動員，隨機分爲對照組和點穴組。

definition: to give or have an acupuncture treatment
top-heavy/fig. unbalance in organization or political structure

(TCM) the four methods of diagnosis, namely 望診|望诊[wang4 zhen3] (observation), 聞診|闻诊[wen2 zhen3] (auscultation and olfaction), 問診|问诊[wen4 zhen3] (interrogation), 切診|切诊[qie4 zhen3] (pulse feeling and palpation)
(TCM) diagnosis based on the patient's pulse/to make such a diagnosis
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
to prick with a needle/to treat by acupuncture
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
